value.title: MIT Has Made A Lego-Like AI Chip That Stacks To Upgrade Your Device
value.excerpt: MIT engineers have now developed an AI chip resembling LEGO as they intend to create modular and sustainable electronics.

value.title: MIT Engineers Build LEGO-like AI Chip
value.excerpt: With a LEGO-like design for a stackable, customizable artificial intelligence chip, MIT engineers have taken a step toward a modular chip design. Traditional wiring is used in other modular chip designs to transmit signals between layers.

value.title: MIT built a new reconfigurable AI chip that can reduce electronic waste
value.excerpt: Is this the end of e-waste? MIT engineers have designed a LEGO-like stackable, reconfigurable AI chip that can be snapped onto a device's internal chip.

value.title: Engineers build LEGO-like artificial intelligence chip
value.excerpt: Imagine a more sustainable future, where cellphones, smartwatches, and other wearable devices don't have to be shelved or discarded for a newer model. Instead, they could be upgraded with the latest sensors and processors that would snap onto a device's internal chip—like LEGO bricks incorporated into an existing build.

value.title: Questioning the ethics of computer chips that use lab-grown human neurons

value.title: To evolve, AI must face its limitations
value.excerpt: And let’s face it: although not perfect, AI’s capabilities are pretty impressive. Even something as seemingly simple and routine as a Google search represents one of AI’s most successful examples, capable of searching vastly more information at a vastly greater rate than humanly possible and consistently providing results that are (at least most of the time) exactly what you were looking for.
